bug.author: lluunn
bug.summary: kfctl apply fails when kfctl init has no --project
bug.description:
If I don't pass --project at kfctl init, it will succeed, but apply will fail: <denchmark-code>kfctl init XXX --package-manager=kustomize --platform=gcp --skip-init-gcp-project kfctl generate all -V kfctl apply all -V ...
couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: coordinator Apply failed for gcp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: gcp apply could not update deployment manager Error could not update storage-kubeflow.yaml: Insert deployment error: googleapi: Error 400: Invalid resource field value in the request., badRequest </denchmark-code>
I thought project could be read from gcloud config. If that's not the case, we should fail earlier at init and provide better error message. cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link>
